item.title: Lisa add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "We are all worms, But I do believe that I am a glow worm." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Anatole France
item.description: "To accomplish great things, we must not only act but also dream, not only plan, but also believe!" -- Anatole France

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "Few things are impossible to diligence and skill. Great works are performed not by strength, but by perseverance." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall." -- Confucius

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Herbert Spencer
item.description: "The preservation of health is a duty. Few seem conscious that there is such a thing as physical morality." -- Herbert Spencer

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Everything has its wonders, even darkness and silence, and I learn, whatever state I may be in, therein to be content" -- Helen Keller

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring." -- Marilyn Monroe
